fu.geo

Class SimpleSpatialIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.geo.SimpleSpatialIndex

  • public class SimpleSpatialIndex
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple spatial index. Geo objects (identified by an int ID) can be registered to the index. The index can then asked which superset of candidates reside in a certain region. The index is based on a grid, i.e. each object is assigned to one or more grid elements. Later the union of all grid cells for a certain region is returned.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleSpatialIndex

        public SimpleSpatialIndex(double minLat,
                          double minLon,
                          double maxLat,
                          double maxLon)
        Creates a spatial index. The area in which objects are stored has to be passed.
        Parameters:
        minLat - MBR min latitude
        minLon - MBR min longitude
        maxLat - MBR max latitude
        maxLon - MBR max longitude

      • SimpleSpatialIndex

        public SimpleSpatialIndex(double minLat,
                          double minLon,
                          double maxLat,
                          double maxLon,
                          int gridSideCnt)
        Creates a spatial index. The area in which objects are stored has to be passed. The caller has to define the number of grid elements per axis (i.e. 100 means an array of 100x100). The gridSideCnt is crucial: if too small (i.e. 10), too many candidates are returned, that have been tested by the caller. If it is too large (i.e. 10000), the storage overhead is larger, as objects may be stored in multiple grids. In addition, asking the index takes longer as results from multiple grid cells have to be unified. As a rule of thumb: grid cells should have a size of 10 times of the average geo object size.
        Parameters:
        minLat - MBR min latitude
        minLon - MBR min longitude
        maxLat - MBR max latitude
        maxLon - MBR max longitude
        gridSideCnt - the number of grid elements per axis (i.e. 100 means an array of 100x100)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int objID,
                double objMinLat,
                double objMinLon,
                double objMaxLat,
                double objMaxLon)
        Registeres a geo object to the index. The object is identified by an ID and its bounding rect.
        Parameters:
        objID - the object ID
        objMinLat - object's MBR min latitude
        objMinLon - object's MBR min longitude
        objMaxLat - object's MBR max latitude
        objMaxLon - object's MBR max longitude

      • add

        public void add(int objID,
                double objMinLat,
                double objMinLon,
                double objMaxLat,
                double objMaxLon,
                boolean mapToRect)
        Registeres a geo object to the index. The object is identified by an ID and its bounding rect.
        Parameters:
        objID - the object ID
        objMinLat - object's MBR min latitude
        objMinLon - object's MBR min longitude
        objMaxLat - object's MBR max latitude
        objMaxLon - object's MBR max longitude
        mapToRect - if true, a bounding rects outisde the covered area is mapped to the covered area. If false, bounding rects outisde the covered area throw an exception

      • compress

        public void compress()
        After all geo objects are stored, the index has to be compresses. This safe space and speeds up candidates queries.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all entries, but keep the initial parameters (i.e. the covered area and number of tiles).

      • candidates

        public int[] candidates(double queryMinLat,
                        double queryMinLon,
                        double queryMaxLat,
                        double queryMaxLon)
        Returns the candidate list that may reside in the given area. All geo objects formerly passed to the index are surely returned, but additional geo objects may be returned. The caller thus has to perform additional tests to filter out these additional geo objects.
        Parameters:
        queryMinLat - query rect min latitude
        queryMinLon - query rect min longitude
        queryMaxLat - query rect max latitude
        queryMaxLon - query rect max longitude
        Returns:
        list of candiate objects IDs
